results.title: The Cutting edge
results.creator_credit: Anthony Buckley, Robert Raymond and Quantum Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Man on the rim series”.
This video, part of a set of four, is about the Pacific Ocean and the people who live around it and across its vast expanse. “Flaming arrows” follows the Siberian hunters who crossed into Alaska and settled America more than 20,000 years ago developing a variety of cultures, arts and technologies. “Changing the menu” watches how the Northern Asians settled into Indonesia and New Guinea, in the process cultivating the new food plants, coconut and rice. “The Cutting edge” traces the technological revolution in Asia which occurred quite independently of those in the original “cradle of civilisation” of the Middle East.

results.title: The Cutting edge
results.brief_description: This program shows us the vital search for mineral deposits. We have to mine deeper, in an environment as alien and hostile as space. We are taken possibly the deepest that cameras have ever filmed - capturing a strange world of machines that mine without explosives, that process rock underground, lifting only valuable payload to the surface. Above ground is a new breed of technology, extracting every mineral particle for the least energy consumption.

results.title: The Cute machine
results.brief_description:
‘The Cute machine’ is an exploration into the morphology of cute characterisation and iconography and its relationship to the biological world, seeking to analyse this ‘Cute ideal’ by correlating it with the Zoological process known as Neoteny

The CD contains two sections that had already been exhibited as installations (Sorry! and Activity Station) but were then adapted to a screen version. The remaining sections elaborate on the themes of cute iconography and its analysis.

The Cute Machine proposes an environment where cute iconography and user friendliness have rampantly accelerated, and reduced computer interface design to the look and sophistication of an infant toy, while also taking the premise, Cute = young to the extreme, where the ‘Cutest’, becomes an abstracted mutation of the original sentiment.

results.title: The Cut of your job
results.brief_description: This film is intended to illustrate the importance of good and appropriate clothing for salesmen. The story is of an unsuccessful salesman who could not get promotion until he is taken in hand by a fellow traveller who persuades him to improve his appearance by wearing better chosen and more appropriate clothing. He is shown choosing a hat, suit and tie and the reason of his choice is explained. The result builds his self confidence and he is then successful in his work.

results.title: The Curtain pole
results.creator_credit: American Mutoscope and Biograph Company and D.W. Griffith
results.brief_description: The lengths a man has to go to just to replace a broken curtain pole and the chaos and mayhem he causes is something to be believed in this farcical slapstick comedy. Cast includes Mack Sennett, Harry Solter, Florence Lawrence, Linda Arvidson, Arthur V. Johnson. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: The Curse = Xala
results.creator_credit: Paulin Soumanou Vieyra, Film Domirev, Societe Nationale Cinematographique and Ousmane Sembene
results.brief_description: Things are not looking good for rich self-made businessman El Hadj Abdoukader Beye in his third marriage. For starters, there is a huge age difference between him and his wife, whose younger than El Hadj’s daughter. Secondly, he is stricken by a xala, a curse which renders him impotent, on his wedding night. It is through his attempts to cure his condition that writer-director Sembene Ousmane conveys a vivid and satirical image of life in post independence Senegal, and the gap between rich and poor and modernity and tradition. Included as part of Africa95, a nationwide season of the arts of Africa, screened throughout the United Kingdom in 1995. In Wolof and French with English subtitles.

results.creator_credit: Larkin Studios, Barclays Bank, Hester Coblentz, Jenny Brisbane, Anne Jolliffe and Beryl Stevens
results.brief_description: An animated reconstruction of the history of money, credit and financial institutions, illustrating the elementary principles involved and the growth of modern practice.

results.title: The Curious coati
results.brief_description: The coati (or coatimundi) is a small Central and South American animal related to the raccoon, and rather like an Australian opossum, but with a very much longer nose. In this film, two baby coatis, because of their inquisitiveness, get into all sorts of mischief in a scientists’ camp in Mexico; coatis are quite fearless, and make good pets.
